Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa's next couple of matches scheduled to be held in Mumbai may be affected by a potential cyclonic storm emerging in the Arabian Sea.

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted a potential cyclonic storm emerging in the southeastern Arabian Sea and the nearby Lakshadweep region within the next 48 hours due to a low-pressure area expected to develop in the Arabian Sea.
Others: South Africa remain the only side other than India and New Zealand to have remained unbeaten in the World Cup 2023 till now.
South Africa's remaining fixtures in ICC World Cup 2023 include matches against England, Bangladesh, Pakistan, New Zealand, India, Afghanistan, and the Netherlands.
